title: How does a Ring doorbell work if you don't have a doorbell? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are two ways to power a Ring doorbell. If you have an existing doorbell, it’s just a matter of hooking the Ring up to the existing wiring. If you have no existing doorbell, you are going to need a transformer from Amazon and a resistor from Digikey. All that information is in the installation instructions. Just know that it takes a few days to get the resistor delivered before you can operate the doorbell. The resistor costs about $10–12. The transformer costs about $22.00 and there are a few choices on Amazon. You can operate the Ring doorbell on it’s internal battery, but you’ll have to pull it out and charge it about once a week. You’ll also have to figure out how to run some bell wire from the transformer to the Ring. You may need an electrician to find a source of 110 volts for the transformer and run the wire. You can buy bell wire on Amazon as well. This makes a good project for a “Home Depot qualified” handy person and you will learn new skills.

Hi.. This isn’t as hard as you might think…I have a couple of friends who have a “Ring” doorbell, and I’m impressed with the video image it produces… The “Ring” people, have already taken people without a standard doorbell, into consideration, with an inserted battery-operated device. I believe it's a little larger than the standard “Ring” doorbell, but the finished product looked good on the video… OK..that being said, a simple “Google” of installing a ring doorbell, you find several DIY videos, of how this works, and installing a battery-operated Ring Doorbell. BTW, the battery for the “Ring” doorbell is unique to the device, and I probably would purchase 2 of the battery inserts. One in-service and one on the charger... If you can reach Quora, you can do some “self-help” on the web with this… Good Luck Dave
